Daha Ã§ok geliÅŸtirilmeye ihtiyacÄ± var.

Ah, Portal 2! Y'know, it must have been really difficult to work out where to take the series after the first game. New puzzles, obviously, but what about Glados? What about the protagonist? How do you take a simple story (with great subtlety), and expand on it, without making it seem stupid (like most sequels)?

But wouldn't you know it, they did it! They gave us a new character AI to talk at you. They gave us Glados. They gave us the backstory to Glados. They gave us the backstory to Aperture Science. They expanded the world. The new song isn't as great as "Still Alive", but it's still sung with as much gusto.

Portal 2 also has a cooperative mode (which I suppose would be the sequel to the single-player campaign), which I haven't tried (because I generally don't do multiplayer), but it's certainly a step in the right direction. 

Along with new puzzles, there are new mechanics, including different types of gels, different ways of moving around, and lasers. I wish there were more lasers. I love lasers.

So, yeah, great game, especially if you like multiplayer. Even if you don't, the main campaign is worth it, especially if you get the game on sale.

Gerek konusu, gerek oynanÄ±ÅŸÄ± herÅŸeyiyle eÅŸsiz bir oyun tÃ¼rÃ¼. Heleki Halflife Ã¶zleminizi biraz bastÄ±rmaniza yeterli oluyor HerÅŸeyiyle diÄŸer oyunlardan Ã§ok farkli, ve asla sÄ±kmayan nadir oyunlardan.

Portal 2 ist ein Sequel zu, ja genau, Portal (Rezension [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198063825413/recommended/400]hier[/url]).

Ich werde hier nur auf die Unterschiede zu Portal eingehen. Ãœberhaupt empfehle ich, Portal zuvor zu spielen, nicht zuletzt, weil die darin erzÃ¤hlte Geschichte merklich aufeinander aufbaut.

Die wesentlichen funktionalen Erweiterungen zu Portal sind:
- Es gibt einen Koop-Modus, in dem man zu zweit rÃ¤tseln kann. Entweder lokal oder Ã¼bers Internet/Steam. Die RÃ¤tsel fand ich ziemlich fordernd.
- Es gibt einen Workshop mit sehr vielen von Usern erstellten, oft sehr guten RÃ¤tseln.
- In der Solo-Kampagne gibt es ein paar neue Features, insbesondere die SoÃŸen.

Das Solospiel bestreitet man wieder mit Chill als alter ego. Ebenso gibt es wieder Begleiter, sichtbare und unsichtbare, die unglaublich amÃ¼sante, sÃ¼ffisante, euphemistische und kaltschnÃ¤uzige Kommentare abgeben. Neben den bekannten TestrÃ¤umen gibt es sehr viele freie Abschnitte, die aber letztlich auch linear aufgebaut sind.

Be3sonders "gefallen" hat mir Cave Johnson, der GrÃ¼nder von Aperture Science, der Firma, die den riesigen unterirdischen Komplex gebaut hat.

Mehr wird von der Geschichte hier nicht verraten. Sie ist jedenfalls originell.

Die Schwierigkeit der RÃ¤tsel ist merklich hÃ¶her, auch wenn sie nie unfair sind.

Das Spiel ist auch deutlich lÃ¤nger. Ich habe etwa 12 Stunden gebraucht, man kann es aber auch deutlich schneller durchspielen.

Ich hatte fast keine Schwierigkeiten, das Spiel unter Windows 10 zu spielen. Nur beim Starten des Spiels ist es (anders als vorher unter Windows 7) bei mir ab und zu abgestÃ¼rzt, wenn der PC schon etwas lÃ¤nger lief.

Pro & Contra:
+ Mindestens so gut wie Portal
+ Gute aber lÃ¶sbare RÃ¤tsel
+ Gute Grafik und Steuerung
+ AmÃ¼sante Geschichte
+ VernÃ¼nftige Kontrollpunkte zum Wiedereinstieg

- (fÃ¤llt mir nichts ein)

Wertung: 10/10

Das Spiel ist, insbesondere im Doppelpack mit Portal (1), ein Highlight des RÃ¤tselspiels.

ì¸ìƒê²Œì„

Today I am wearing lacy black underwear

For the sole purpose of knowing I am wearing them.

And underneath that?

I am absolutely naked.

And Iâ€™ve got skin. Miles and miles of skin;

Iâ€™ve got skin to cover all my thoughts

like saran wrap that you can see through

to what leftovers are inside from the night before.

And despite what you might think, my skin is not rough; nor is it bullet proof.

My skin is soft, and smooth, and easily scarred.

But that doesnâ€™t matter, right?

You donâ€™t care about how soft my skin is.

You just want to hear about what my fingers do in the dark.

But what if all they do is crack open windows?

So I can see lightening through the clouds.

What if all they crave is a jungle gym to climb for a taste of fresher air?

What if all they reach for is a notebook or a hand to hold?

But thatâ€™s not the story you want.

You are licking your lips and baring your teeth.

Just once I would like to be the direction someone else is going.

I donâ€™t need to be the water in the well.

I donâ€™t need to be the well.

But Iâ€™d like to not be the ground anymore.

Iâ€™d like to not be the thing people dig their hands in anymore.

Some girls know all the lyrics to each otherâ€™s songs.

They find harmonies in their laughter.

Their linked elbows echo in tune.

What if I canâ€™t hum on key?

What if my melodies are the ones nobody hears?

Some people can recognize a tree,

A front yard, and know theyâ€™ve made it home.

How many circles can I walk in before I give up looking?

How long before Iâ€™m lost for good.

It must be possible to swim in the ocean of the one you love without drowning.

It must be possible to swim without becoming water yourself.

But I keep swallowing what I thought was air.

I keep finding stones tied to my feet.

awesome game.

Portal 2 is a game that isn't for everyone, but I really wish it is. Because everyone should experience this masterpiece. The puzzles are really hard sometimes, but incredibly fun to solve. But the parts where this game really shines is its story, and aesthetic. The story is perfect. Even the humor works which is something not every video game can manage to pull off. The story has extremely memorable characters, but a dark tone and amazing pacing. The aesthetic of this game is classic Valve. This is why they are the best game developers on the planet. The aesthetic changes throughout the story, but maintains this dark and hopeless mood, with humor thrown in. Its simply perfect. 10/10
